entity.name: Maya - Ah Puch
entity.subtitle: Ah Pukuh- "The Destroyer" / "The Fleshless One"
entity.description: The terrifying god of death, decay, and the underworld, Ah Puch rules over Xibalba, the Maya realm of the dead. Depicted as a skeletal figure with protruding ribs, exposed spine, and a bloated belly of corruption, he embodies the horror and inevitability of death. Yet the Maya understood death not as an end but as a transformation - and Ah Puch, however fearsome, was part of the cosmic cycle that made rebirth possible. His defeat by the Hero Twins established the pattern of death and resurrection at the heart of Maya religion.

worship.signs of ah puch:
• The screech owl: Called Muan, its cry heralded death
  • Dogs howling: Said to sense Ah Puch approaching
  • Decay smell: Associated with his name "Kisin" (Stinking One)
  • Day Kimi: The calendar day of death, considered unlucky for beginnings
worship.protective measures:
• Wailing and screaming: Loud noises thought to frighten death away from the sick
  • Offerings: Food, incense, and other gifts placed at crossroads
  • Burial goods: Provisions for the dead's journey through Xibalba
  • Dog sacrifice: Dogs to guide the dead through the underworld

archetype.name: DEATH GOD
archetype.description: Ah Puch embodies the Death God archetype - ruler of the underworld, lord of decay, yet essential to the cosmic cycle of death and rebirth.
